lines.text: It's, uh... it's almost like fate, isn't it?
Hmm. Fate's fine as long as you take it by its own two horns and make it come your way.
Don't be a flirt. You might get hurt.
Men are men. They're all got the same talk.
I don't know why Indians should get so all-fired smart, just 'cause they died.
I'm a phobophobe.
You're a what?
A phobophobe. That means I'm afraid of being afraid.
I see.
Well, I don't understand it either, but according to psychoanalysts, it's all because I was a child.
Oh, what a lovely corsage. Too bad I'm not a horse.
Toni, I met your old aunt.
You... you met my old aunt?
Mmm-hmm. And next time, tell her she needs a shave.
Where we going?
I'm going to take you out and BEAT you to death. Hey, come here!
How men can be so simple. Good night. Trueboy knows more about women than you do.
And who is Trueboy?
One of Grandpa's hogs.
Hogs?
Well, hogs are very nice people, thank you. You wouldn't catch one of them going around telling somebody they loved them when they're going to "eventually" somebody else.

[angered]
And who did I go around telling them I loved them?
I suppose you weren't whooping for your dead Indian right out on that dance floor.
When and where I whoop for my dead Indian is my affair, I believe. And what that's gotta do with telling anyone I love them, I don't know.
Well... you... coyote! Let me tell you something. If that's the way it comes out of the top drawer, you can just slam it.
I'm none the least intelligent, thank heavens. I don't believe in women being intelligent. That's a man's job. Women shouldn't think, they should just feel.
